Name: Develop Educational Offerings
Documentation: The end-to-end process of designing, creating, and launching new academic programs and courses.

Name: Define Program
Documentation: The stage of identifying market needs and defining the structure and goals of a new academic program.

Name: Analyze Market Needs
Documentation: The process of researching industry trends, employer demands, and prospective student interest to justify a new program.

Name: Design Program Structure
Documentation: The process of defining the program's curriculum framework, learning outcomes, and degree requirements.

Name: Develop Curriculum
Documentation: The stage of creating the detailed content and assessment methods for all courses within a new program.

Name: Create Course Content
Documentation: The process of developing syllabi, lecture materials, assignments, and other learning resources for a specific course.

Name: Define Assessment Methods
Documentation: The process of establishing the tools and criteria for evaluating student learning, such as exams, projects, and grading rubrics.

Name: Launch Offering
Documentation: The stage of marketing the new program and opening the enrollment process to prospective students.

Name: Market Program
Documentation: The process of promoting the new offering to target audiences through various channels to attract applicants.

Name: Open Enrollment
Documentation: The process of formally opening the application and registration systems for the new program.

Name: Build Research Capabilities
Documentation: The end-to-end process of establishing the foundational resources, expertise, and infrastructure required to conduct research.

Name: Establish Research Area
Documentation: The stage of identifying a strategic research focus and securing initial support.

Name: Identify Niche
Documentation: The process of determining a specific, viable area of research focus based on institutional strengths and funding opportunities.

Name: Secure Seed Funding
Documentation: The process of acquiring initial internal or external funds to launch a new research initiative.

Name: Provision Resources
Documentation: The stage of acquiring the necessary physical and technological infrastructure for research activities.

Name: Acquire Facilities
Documentation: The process of securing and preparing laboratory, office, or other physical spaces for research.

Name: Procure Equipment
Documentation: The process of purchasing, installing, and commissioning specialized scientific or technical equipment.

Name: Cultivate Expertise
Documentation: The stage of assembling and developing a team of skilled researchers.

Name: Recruit Researchers
Documentation: The process of hiring faculty, postdoctoral fellows, and technical staff with the required expertise.

Name: Foster Collaboration
Documentation: The process of establishing partnerships and networks to enhance research capacity and impact.

Name: Deliver Education
Documentation: The end-to-end process of admitting, instructing, and graduating students in an established academic program.

Name: Admit & Onboard Student
Documentation: The stage of processing applications, admitting qualified candidates, and integrating them into the university.

Name: Process Applications
Documentation: The process of receiving, reviewing, and making decisions on student applications for admission.

Name: Orient New Students
Documentation: The process of providing newly admitted students with essential information and resources to begin their studies.

Name: Educate & Assess Student
Documentation: The stage of delivering instruction and evaluating student performance against learning objectives.

Name: Deliver Instruction
Documentation: The process of conducting lectures, labs, seminars, and other educational activities.

Name: Evaluate Performance
Documentation: The process of grading assignments, administering exams, and providing feedback to measure student learning.

Name: Graduate Student
Documentation: The stage of verifying academic completion and formally conferring degrees or credentials.

Name: Verify Completion
Documentation: The process of auditing a student's academic record to confirm all degree requirements have been met.

Name: Confer Degree
Documentation: The process of formally awarding the diploma and recognizing the student's academic achievement.

Name: Conduct Funded Research
Documentation: The end-to-end process of securing external funding, executing a research project, and disseminating the results.

Name: Acquire Funding
Documentation: The stage of preparing and submitting proposals to funding agencies to secure financial support for research.

Name: Write Grant Proposal
Documentation: The process of drafting a detailed research plan, budget, and justification for a funding application.

Name: Submit & Negotiate
Documentation: The process of formally submitting the proposal and negotiating the terms of the award with the funding body.

Name: Conduct Investigation
Documentation: The stage of executing the planned research activities, including data collection and analysis.

Name: Collect Data
Documentation: The process of performing experiments, running simulations, or gathering information according to the research design.

Name: Analyze Results
Documentation: The process of interpreting collected data to draw conclusions and generate new insights.

Name: Publish Findings
Documentation: The stage of preparing and disseminating research results to the academic community and the public.

Name: Draft Manuscript
Documentation: The process of writing a scholarly article, report, or book detailing the research methodology, findings, and conclusions.

Name: Peer Review & Publish
Documentation: The process of submitting the manuscript to a journal or publisher and undergoing review by other experts in the field.

Name: Commercialize IP
Documentation: The stage of protecting and licensing intellectual property generated from research.

Name: File Patent
Documentation: The process of preparing and submitting an application to a patent office to protect an invention.

Name: License Technology
Documentation: The process of negotiating agreements with external parties to use the university's patented technology.

Name: Research Management
Documentation: The ability to oversee the entire research lifecycle, from proposal development to publication and commercialization.

Name: Research Proposal Development
Documentation: The ability to create and submit compelling grant proposals to secure external research funding.

Name: Grant Writing
Documentation: The ability to articulate research plans, justifications, and impacts in a formal proposal document.

Name: Budget Formulation
Documentation: The ability to develop accurate and compliant budgets for proposed research projects.

Name: Scientific Investigation
Documentation: The ability to design and execute rigorous research projects to generate new knowledge.

Name: Data Collection & Experimentation
Documentation: The ability to execute research protocols, conduct experiments, and gather data in a systematic manner.

Name: Data Analysis & Interpretation
Documentation: The ability to apply statistical and analytical methods to interpret research data and derive meaningful conclusions.

Name: Research Data Curation
Documentation: The ability to manage, preserve, and provide access to research datasets in a secure and organized manner.

Name: Data Storage & Archiving
Documentation: The ability to securely store and archive research data for long-term preservation and reuse.

Name: Data Sharing & Publication
Documentation: The ability to prepare and share datasets in accordance with funder mandates and academic best practices.

Name: IP Management
Documentation: The ability to identify, protect, and manage intellectual property arising from research activities.

Name: Patent Filing & Prosecution
Documentation: The ability to prepare and file patent applications and manage the process with patent offices.

Name: IP Portfolio Analysis
Documentation: The ability to assess the commercial potential and strategic value of intellectual property assets.

Name: Scholarly Publishing
Documentation: The ability to prepare, review, and disseminate research findings through academic journals and other scholarly channels.

Name: Manuscript Preparation
Documentation: The ability to write and format research findings for publication in a scholarly format.

Name: Peer Review Coordination
Documentation: The ability to manage the submission and peer review process for scholarly publications.

Name: Technology Licensing
Documentation: The ability to negotiate and manage legal agreements for the commercial use of university-owned intellectual property.

Name: Contract Negotiation
Documentation: The ability to negotiate terms and execute legal agreements for technology transfer and licensing.

Name: Royalty Management
Documentation: The ability to track and manage income generated from intellectual property licenses.

Name: Education Management
Documentation: The ability to design, develop, deliver, and oversee all aspects of the university's academic programs.

Name: Program Portfolio Management
Documentation: The ability to strategically manage the university's portfolio of academic programs, including creation, review, and retirement.

Name: Market Needs Analysis
Documentation: The ability to research and analyze market and industry trends to inform new program development.

Name: Program Structure Design
Documentation: The ability to define the curriculum framework, learning outcomes, and requirements for an academic program.

Name: Curriculum Design & Development
Documentation: The ability to create and refine the content, structure, and learning outcomes of academic courses and programs.

Name: Course Content Creation
Documentation: The ability to develop syllabi, learning materials, and activities for a specific course.

Name: Assessment Method Design
Documentation: The ability to create valid and reliable methods for evaluating student learning, such as exams and rubrics.

Name: Instructional Delivery & Assessment
Documentation: The ability to effectively teach students and evaluate their learning through various pedagogical and assessment methods.

Name: Instruction Delivery
Documentation: The ability to conduct lectures, labs, and other learning activities in various modalities.

Name: Performance Evaluation
Documentation: The ability to grade student work, provide feedback, and assess achievement of learning outcomes.

Name: Credential Awarding
Documentation: The ability to verify student completion of academic requirements and formally confer degrees and other credentials.

Name: Academic Requirement Auditing
Documentation: The ability to audit student records to ensure all graduation requirements have been met.

Name: Degree Conferral
Documentation: The ability to formally issue diplomas and other credentials to graduating students.

Name: Student Lifecycle Management
Documentation: The ability to manage the entire student journey, from recruitment and admission to advising and progression tracking.

Name: Student Recruitment & Selection
Documentation: The ability to attract, evaluate, and admit qualified students to the university.

Name: Student Advising & Support
Documentation: The ability to provide academic guidance and support services to ensure student success and well-being.

Name: Student Progression Tracking
Documentation: The ability to monitor and manage students' academic progress towards the completion of their degree requirements.

Name: Faculty Management
Documentation: The ability to manage the lifecycle and professional activities of faculty members.

Name: Faculty Expertise Management
Documentation: The ability to manage information about faculty qualifications, research interests, and professional activities.

Name: Faculty Recruitment
Documentation: The ability to attract, hire, and onboard qualified faculty members.

Name: Professional Development
Documentation: The ability to support the ongoing growth and development of faculty in teaching and research.

Name: Academic Resource Management
Documentation: The ability to manage the physical and digital resources that support teaching and research activities.

Name: Resource Planning & Allocation
Documentation: The ability to strategically plan and allocate budget and space for academic and research purposes.

Name: Capital Budgeting
Documentation: The ability to plan and manage the budget for long-term investments in facilities and equipment.

Name: Space Utilization Analysis
Documentation: The ability to analyze and optimize the use of physical space across the institution.

Name: Research Facility Management
Documentation: The ability to operate and maintain specialized laboratories and research centers.

Name: Lab Space Allocation
Documentation: The ability to assign and manage the use of laboratory and research spaces.

Name: Equipment Maintenance
Documentation: The ability to maintain, repair, and manage the lifecycle of specialized research equipment.

Name: Library & Archive Management
Documentation: The ability to curate, maintain, and provide access to scholarly collections, books, and historical archives.

Name: Collection Development
Documentation: The ability to acquire and manage scholarly resources, including books, journals, and databases.

Name: Information Services
Documentation: The ability to provide research assistance and access to information for students and faculty.

Name: Teaching Space Management
Documentation: The ability to schedule, equip, and maintain classrooms, lecture halls, and other instructional spaces.

Name: Classroom Scheduling
Documentation: The ability to manage the timetable and allocation of instructional spaces.

Name: AV Technology Support
Documentation: The ability to equip and support the audio-visual technology used in teaching spaces.

Name: Research Asset
Documentation: An information asset related to the planning, execution, and dissemination of research.

Name: Grant Proposal
Documentation: A formal document submitted to a funding body to request financial support for a research project.

Name: Research Dataset
Documentation: A curated collection of data generated or used during a research investigation.

Name: Scholarly Work
Documentation: A manuscript, article, or book that communicates the findings of a research project.

Name: Patent Application
Documentation: A legal document filed to protect the intellectual property rights of an invention.

Name: License Agreement
Documentation: A legal contract granting a third party the rights to use university-owned intellectual property.

Name: Education Asset
Documentation: An information asset related to the definition, delivery, and outcomes of academic programs.

Name: Program Catalog
Documentation: A comprehensive listing and description of all academic programs and courses offered by the university.

Name: Course Syllabus
Documentation: A document outlining the objectives, content, schedule, and assessment criteria for a specific academic course.

Name: Student Transcript
Documentation: An official record of a student's academic performance, including courses taken and grades received.

Name: Diploma
Documentation: A formal document issued by the university certifying the successful completion of a degree program.

Name: Student Asset
Documentation: An information asset containing data about prospective and enrolled students.

Name: Student Application
Documentation: A collection of documents and data submitted by a prospective student for admission.

Name: Enrolled Student Record
Documentation: A comprehensive record of an admitted student's academic and administrative information.

Name: Infrastructure Asset
Documentation: An information asset describing the university's physical and digital resources for teaching and research.

Name: Research Facility Record
Documentation: A record detailing the specifications, availability, and usage of a research laboratory or facility.

Name: Teaching Space Record
Documentation: A record detailing the capacity, features, and schedule of a classroom or lecture hall.

Name: Library Collection Record
Documentation: A catalog entry for a book, journal, or other resource held by the university library.

Name: Faculty Asset
Documentation: An information asset containing data about faculty members.

Name: Faculty Profile
Documentation: A record of a faculty member's credentials, publications, research interests, and teaching assignments.
